page.title: 01THE ARLEY AND ASTLEY AREA
page.content: The area, on the northern side of Nuneaton in Warwickshire, lies only 20 miles from the industrial region of Birmingham but is linked much more closely with Coventry. It consists mainly of open country/farmland and a few patches of woodland, the main areas of population being the villages of Arley and Astley. These have their roots back to the original Domesday survey but the coal industry at the beginning of this century has done most to shape the nature and culture of the people. Nevertheless farms and farming occupy much of the land cover and activity and a deep cultural heritage is evident in the number of historical buildings and places of interest.
